abstract: Taiwan not only has in place a national health care system, but it also takes advantage of information technology far more frequently than the United States does, an economist writes.
snippet: Taiwan not only has in place a national health care system, but it also takes advantage of information technology far more frequently than the United States does, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton. He has some financial interests in the health care field.
